org.accada.reader.rprm.core
Class Source

java.lang.Object
  org.accada.reader.rprm.core.Source

public final class Source
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents the Source of the object model.

Author:
Markus Vitalini

Nested Class Summary
 class Source.ReaderAndReadPoints
          This class contains a reader (HardwareAbstraction) and all of its read points (ReadPoint) It is used to simplify read and write calls.

Method Detail

create

public static Source create(java.lang.String name,
                            ReaderDevice readerDevice)
                     throws ReaderProtocolException
Create a source object with a given name. If a source object with the same name exists, an error is returned ("ERROR_OBJECT_EXISTS"). This is a static method. The source shall implicitly be added to the list of all sources kept by the ReaderDevice object.

Parameters:
name - The name of the source
readerDevice - The reader device it belongs to
Returns:
The instance of the new source
Throws:
ReaderProtocolException - "ERROR_UNKNOWN"

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of the source.

Returns:
The name of the source

isFixed

public boolean isFixed()
Check if the source is fixed.

Returns:
'true' if the source is fixed, otherwise false

public void setFixed(boolean isFixed)
Sets the fixed flag.

Parameters:
isFixed - Indicate if the source is fixed

addReadPoints

public void addReadPoints(ReadPoint[] readPointList)
Adds the specified ReadPoints to the list of readpoints currently associated with this source. If some of the ReadPoints to be added are already associated with this source, only the not yet associated ReadPoints will be added.

Parameters:
readPointList - The list of readpoints

removeReadPoints

public void removeReadPoints(ReadPoint[] readPointList)
Removes the specified ReadPoints from the list of ReadPoints currently associated with this source.

Parameters:
readPointList - The list of readpoints

rawReadIDs

public ReadReport rawReadIDs(DataSelector dataselector)
Performs a single read cycle without using the corresponding Source objects list of TagSelectors. The resulting ReadReport shall be formatted according to the given DataSelector.

Parameters:
dataselector - The data selector to use
Returns:
The read report

readIDs

public ReadReport readIDs(DataSelector dataselector)
Performs multiple read cycles using all TagSelectors currently associated with this Source. The number of read cycles performed shall be determined by the value of the Source attribute ReadCyclesPerTrigger.The resulting ReadReport is formatted according to the given DataSelector. If a tag is seen in several read cycles, it shall only be reported once. Note that this command does not use event generation.

Parameters:
dataselector - The data selector to use
Returns:
The read report

read

public ReadReport read(DataSelector dataSelector,
                       java.util.Hashtable passwords)
Performs multiple read cycles on the selected group of tags. The number of read cycles performed shall be determined by the value of the Source attribute ReadCyclesPerTrigger. The resulting ReadReport is formatted according to the given DataSelector. If a tag is seen in several read cycles, it shall only be reported once. Note that this command does not apply tag smoothing

Parameters:
dataSelector - The data selector to use
passwords - Not yet supported
Returns:
The read report

readWithEventGeneration

public void readWithEventGeneration(DataSelector dataSelector,
                                    Trigger trigger)
Performs a single read cycle (with event generation).

Parameters:
dataSelector - The dataselector for report generation
trigger - The trigger that caused the call of this method

writeID

public void writeID(java.lang.String newID,
                    java.lang.String[] passwords,
                    TagSelector[] tagSelectorList)
             throws ReaderProtocolException
Programs a tag with the given ID and the optionally specified passwords.

Parameters:
newID - The new id
passwords - An optional list of one or more passwords (or lock code). The use of passwords is dependent upon the tag's RF protocol
tagSelectorList - Not in use // TODO: Remove this parameter.
Throws:
ReaderProtocolException - "ERROR_MULTIPLE_TAGS"

write

public void write(TagFieldValue[] tagFieldValueList,
                  java.lang.String[] passwords,
                  TagSelector[] tagSelectorList)
           throws ReaderProtocolException
Writes the specified TagFieldValues to one or more tags. A list of TagSelector objects can be used to select a set of tags, in the readers field of view, for writing.

Parameters:
tagFieldValueList - The date to write on the tag
passwords - An optional list of one or more passwords (or lock code). The use of passwords is dependent upon the tag's RF protocol
tagSelectorList - The tag selectors
Throws:
ReaderProtocolException - "ERROR_UNKNOWN"

kill

public void kill(java.lang.String[] passwords,
                 TagSelector[] tagSelectorList)
          throws ReaderProtocolException
Kills the specified tag or group of tags. An list of TagSelector objects can be specified with this command.

Parameters:
passwords - Not yet supported
tagSelectorList - The tag selectors
Throws:
ReaderProtocolException - "ERROR_MULTIPLE_TAGS", "ERROR_NO_TAG", "ERROR_UNKNOWN"

protected void addTagToReport(java.lang.String tagId,
                              SourceReport report,
                              DataSelector dataSelector,
                              java.util.Vector closure,
                              Trigger trigger)
                       throws org.accada.hal.HardwareException

Parameters:
tagId - The tag to add
report - The report to modify
dataSelector - The data to report
closure - The closure
trigger - The trigger that caused the event
Throws:
TagMemoryServiceException - Problems with the tag memory
org.accada.hal.HardwareException - Problems with the HAL

                                          java.util.Vector closure,
                                          Trigger trigger)

isRelevantTag

protected boolean isRelevantTag(java.lang.String tagId,
                                java.util.Hashtable allTagSelectors,
                                java.util.Vector closure)
                         throws ReaderProtocolException
Checks if a tag is relevant (dependant of the TagSelectors).

Parameters:
tagId - The tag to check
allTagSelectors - The TagSelectors
closure - The reader and its readpoints
Returns:
Returns 'true' if the tag is relevant, 'false' otherwise
Throws:
ReaderProtocolException - "ERROR_UNKNOWN"

getReaderAndReadPoints

protected java.util.Vector getReaderAndReadPoints()
Computes the ReaderAndReadPoint elements of this source. A ReaderAndReadPoints element contains one reader instance (HardwareAbstraction) and all of ist read points associated with this source.

Returns:
Vector of ReaderAndReadPoints elements

getSourceReport

public SourceReport getSourceReport()
Returns the source report. This report contains all information about tags, reader and source needed to generate the final reports of the notification channels.

Returns:
Returns the sourceReport

setSourceReport

public void setSourceReport(SourceReport sourceReport)
Sets the source report. This report contains all information about tags, reader and source needed to generate the final reports of the notification channels.

Parameters:
sourceReport - The sourceReport to set

public void addNotificationChannel(NotificationChannel notificationChannel)
Adds a notification channel. This notification channels should be informed about new events (NotificationChannel.addSourceReport())

Parameters:
notificationChannel - The channels

removeNotificationChannel

public void removeNotificationChannel(NotificationChannel notificationChannel)
Removes a notification channel This notification channels should be informed about new events (NotificationChannel.addSourceReport()).

Parameters:
notificationChannel - The channels to remove

getOperStatusAlarmControl

public TTOperationalStatusAlarmControl getOperStatusAlarmControl()
Returns the operStatusAlarmControl attribute of this source. This attribute is the object that controls the conditions for generating alarms alerting a manager of changes in a Source's operational status.

Returns:
The alarm control for monitoring the operational status of the Source

                                throws ReaderProtocolException
